New Records: Kyle Hendricks tossed 7 1/3 shutout innings, holding the Cincinnati Reds to only two hits in a 3-0 victory.
Hendricks had the third-longest streak of consecutive starts with no more than four earned runs allowed (48) in Cubs history behind Greg Maddux (55) and Jake Arrieta (52)
Key Match Events: Fans roared and gave Hendricks an ovation as his warmup song 'Sweet Emotion' played during the eighth inning.
Hendricks was pulled from the game and received hugs from his teammates and coaches before the curtain call.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Craig Counsell told young players that Saturday would be a memorable day they would never forget.
Post-Match Reflections: Ian Happ read Hendricks' career accomplishments to teammates, highlighting his 48 consecutive starts with no more than four earned runs allowed.
Counsell noted Hendricks' resilience and ability to perform despite challenges during the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: More than 38,180 fans attended the game at Wrigley Field.
Hendricks' final moments included posing for photos with his son in shallow left field with the ivy and scoreboard in the background.
